definitions:
(poetic) to venerate, revere
Synonyms: adorare, riverire, venerare
etymology: From Latin colere, present active infinitive of colō (“I worship” ← “I protect” ← “I cultivate”), from earlier *quelō, from Proto-Italic *kʷelō, from Proto-Indo-European *kʷéleti, derived from the root *kʷel- (“to move; to turn (around)”).
